Unit 1: How do different places affect us?
This week in Reading: Realistic Fiction, Informational Text, Poetry
Students will read various texts that are realistic fiction, informational text, and poetry.
Realistic Fiction: A story that is made up but can happen in real life. A realistic fiction story will have characters, setting, and a plot (beginning, middle, end).
Informational Text: Gives us information. Informational text will have labels, diagrams, picture, bold words, and captions.
Poetry: Tells a story, appeals to feelings and senses, using descriptive words. Poetry will have rhyme, rhythm, lines, and stanzas.
